properties.text:
Now, Ångström and the tardigrade find themselves in an even more dangerous area. The quantum waves in this region are out of control, and the tardigrade’s health is beginning to deteriorate rapidly.

The only way to save it is to create waves that cancel out those attacking it, using destructive interference.

If Ångström manages to combine the waves to nullify their effects, they will be able to cross safely. If he fails, the tardigrade may disappear!

You must manipulate the green waves, identify the dominant frequencies in the attacking red waves, and generate an opposing wave to cancel them out (interference in yellow). 

This is achieved when two waves of the same frequency and amplitude are out of phase, canceling their effects. 

You must do this for three different attacking waves; if you succeed, you will advance to the next level.

Wave interference is a phenomenon used in both quantum and classical physics. It occurs when two waves (of any type: light, sound, etc.) are combined.

If the waves are in phase (peaks coincide with peaks), constructive interference occurs, increasing the amplitude of the resulting wave.

If they are in opposite phases (peaks coincide with troughs), destructive interference occurs, canceling or decreasing the amplitude.
